msContents.summary: Manuscript is used for contemplation, study, and recitation and is dedicated to the Hindu bird-deity Garuḍa, who also serves as a vehicle for the deity Viṣṇu. The work promotes Vedanta philosophy from a Vaiṣṇava perspective and is likely a late upaniṣad dating to the medieval period.
